headline: Arizona leaders react to Russian invasion of Ukraine
sentences: ARIZONA, USA — Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine Thursday, unleashing airstrikes on cities and military bases and sending in troops and tanks from three sides in an attack that could rewrite the post-Cold War security order.

— Raul M. Grijalva (@RepRaulGrijalva) February 24, 2022
Please join me in praying for the people of Ukraine as they endure a senseless and unprovoked attack at the hands of Vladimir Putin.
We join our nation and the free world in condemning the unprovoked act of aggression against them, and we are praying for every innocent life and a swift resolution to this conflict.
The U.S. stands with Ukraine and must prepare to assist with the unfolding humanitarian crisis and the millions who will be displaced by this unnecessary war.????????

— Wendy Rogers (@WendyRogersAZ) February 24, 2022
Russia’s invasion will not go unanswered and the world will respond with unity and diplomacy as guiding principles.
Biden's failure to take action early and cut Putin off at the knees will embolden China and put the independence of Taiwan at severe risk.

— Rep Andy Biggs (@RepAndyBiggsAZ) February 24, 2022
We are not Germany’s cannon fodder against the Russians.
I am thinking tonight of the Ukrainian people, who want nothing but peace, yet are now under attack and in a war for their homeland.

— Congresswoman Debbie Lesko (@RepDLesko) February 24, 2022

He bears responsibility and must be held to account.”
China is watching how President Biden responds to Putin's incursion.

"Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is unprovoked and unjust.

— Doug Ducey (@dougducey) February 24, 2022
Trump did the impossible and brought peace to the Middle East.
“The United States, alongside our NATO allies, must be resolute in our support for the Ukrainian people.
If we get involved it will be after Germany, France, Italy & the rest have done most of the fighting.
We must never forget these heinous acts and must respond swiftly with the highest level of sanctions.
As tensions continue to rise, Arizona leaders have been quick to react to the latest turn of events.
As tensions continue to rise, Arizona leaders have been quick to react to the latest turn of events.
And we must work to quickly impose the maximum sanctions on Putin and the Russian government.
That is how we did it during World War II & we had a Declaration of War.
Biden did the impossible and brought war to Europe.
“Putin has chosen a devastating and illegal war.
We have lost way to many men to Europe’s wars.
Arizona stands with the people of Ukraine.
Their cause is our cause.
